iiv.display

Class DisplayComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • iiv.display.DisplayComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LocationMapping, ShowPointImage, Croppable, FilterSampling, Flippable, Rotatable, Zoomable, CNUFileObject, ShowStatus, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CNUStdImgFile, DisplayColorMap, DisplayColorMapQuilt, DisplayDraw, ScriptableDisplayComponent, SingleImg

    public abstract class DisplayComponent
extends JComponent
implements ShowStatus, CNUFileObject, Zoomable, Rotatable, FilterSampling, Flippable, Croppable, LocationMapping, ShowPointImage
    DisplayComponent defines standard routines specific to a components displayed by iiV.
    Since:
    iiV1.0
    See Also:
    CNUDisplay, Serialized Form

      • setGrabColorModelState

        public void setGrabColorModelState(boolean grabColorModel)
        Sets whether the color model will be grabbed from the image producer. Only grabbed if the current color model is null. This is a work around to get the color model for iiv.io.CNUStdImageFile but not get it for shapes extending DisplayDraw.
        Parameters:
        grabColorModel - true to allow grabbing

      • getIndices

        public int[] getIndices(Point pt)
        Gets the indices corresponding to the original raw data this display component is created from based on a point relative to the component. This default implementation transforms the point with trueLocation and calls getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint.
        Specified by:
        getIndices in interface ShowPointImage
        Parameters:
        pt - point location relative to component
        Returns:
        indices indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions or null if invalid point

      • getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint

        public int[] getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint(Point pt)
        Gets the indices corresponding to the original raw data this display component is created from based on a point relative to the non-filtered (no flip, rotation, zoom, or offset) image. This default implementation returns the original point stored in a 2-dimensional int array.
        Parameters:
        pt - point location relative to non-filtered image
        Returns:
        indices indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions or null if invalid point

      • getPoint

        public Point getPoint(int[] indices)
        Gets the point relative to the component given the indices corresponding to the original raw data this display component is created from.
        Specified by:
        getPoint in interface ShowPointImage
        Parameters:
        indices - indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions
        Returns:
        location relative to the component. Indices that map off the image are forced onto the image.

      • getNonfilteredPoint

        public Point getNonfilteredPoint(int[] indices)
        Gets the point relative to the non-filtered (no flip, rotation, zoom, or offset) image given the indices corresponding to the original raw data this display component is created from. This default implementation returns the indices stored in a Point object.
        Parameters:
        indices - indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions
        Returns:
        location relative to non-filtered image (negative value for x or y indicates the indice doesn't map to that dimension)

      • onImage

        public boolean onImage(int[] indices)
        Determines if the given indices relative to the raw data are located on the display image before cropping.
        Parameters:
        indices - indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions
        Returns:
        true if indices are located on the image this component represents.

        Parameters:
        indices - indices to data
        Returns:
        value to display

        Returns:

        public int getImageRGB(Point pt)
        Get the RGB value of a point over the image.
        Parameters:
        pt - location to get RGB value of.
        Returns:
        pixel value in default RGB color model.

      • getFactor

        public double getFactor()
        Gets the quantification factor at this indice.
        Returns:
        quantification factor (this default implementation returns value from protected method getFactor())

        Parameters:

        public void setCrosshair(int[] indices,
                         Color crosshairColor)
        Erases the old crosshair a draws a new one on this component.
        Specified by:
        setCrosshair in interface ShowPointImage
        Parameters:
        indices - indices the crosshair points to
        crosshairColor - color of crosshair
